_comment: IEC (International Electrotechnical Commission) standards database - comprehensive electrical, electronic, and related technology standards. Last updated: January 2025

norms.name: IEC 62368-1 - Audio/Video, ICT Equipment Safety (HBSE)
norms.applies_to: Audio/video equipment, ICT equipment, communication equipment
norms.description: Hazard-based safety engineering (HBSE) standard for audio/video, information and communication technology equipment. Replaces IEC 60950-1 (IT) and IEC 60065 (AV). Covers energy sources, fire ignition, mechanical hazards, chemical hazards. Risk-based methodology focusing on safeguards against pain, injury, and fire.

norms.name: IEC 60950-1 - IT Equipment Safety (Superseded)
norms.description: Safety requirements for IT equipment including mains-powered and battery-powered equipment. Superseded by IEC 62368-1 in 2020 but still widely recognized. Covers electrical safety, fire hazards, mechanical hazards, energy hazards, thermal hazards. Edition 2.2 (2013) was final version.

norms.name: IEC 60335-1 - Household Appliance Safety Part 1: General Requirements
norms.applies_to: Household electrical appliances, similar electrical equipment up to 250V
norms.description: General safety requirements for household and similar electrical appliances. Foundation standard with specific Part 2 requirements for different appliance types. Covers electrical, mechanical, thermal hazards, protection against electric shock, insulation requirements, stability, mechanical strength.

norms.name: IEC 60335-2 Series - Particular Requirements for Specific Appliances
norms.description: Particular requirements supplementing IEC 60335-1 for specific appliances. Examples: Part 2-6 (cooking ranges), Part 2-7 (washing machines), Part 2-24 (refrigerators), Part 2-40 (heat pumps), Part 2-89 (commercial refrigeration). Each part addresses hazards specific to appliance type.

norms.name: IEC 61000 - Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC)
norms.description: Comprehensive EMC standard series. Part 4: Testing and measurement techniques. Part 6: Generic standards (immunity/emission for residential, commercial, industrial). Defines immunity to ESD, radiated RF, electrical fast transients, surge, conducted disturbances, voltage dips/interruptions, harmonics, flicker.

norms.name: IEC 61000-4-2 - Electrostatic Discharge (ESD) Immunity
norms.applies_to: All electronic equipment susceptible to ESD
norms.description: Testing and measurement techniques for electrostatic discharge immunity. Defines test levels (1-4), test methods (contact discharge, air discharge), test equipment requirements. Contact discharge: ±2kV to ±8kV. Air discharge: ±2kV to ±15kV. Essential for equipment reliability.

norms.name: IEC 61000-4-3 - Radiated RF Immunity
norms.description: Radiated, radio-frequency, electromagnetic field immunity test. Frequency range 80 MHz to 6 GHz. Test levels: 1 V/m to 30 V/m. Amplitude modulation 80% at 1 kHz. Ensures equipment immunity to RF transmitters, mobile phones, wireless devices.

norms.name: IEC 61000-4-4 - Electrical Fast Transient/Burst Immunity
norms.applies_to: Equipment connected to AC/DC power, control, signal lines
norms.description: Immunity to electrical fast transients (EFT/burst) from switching transients. Test levels 0.5 kV to 4 kV. Simulates transients from relay switching, circuit breaker operation. Tests AC power, DC power, signal/control ports. Critical for industrial equipment reliability.

norms.name: IEC 61000-4-5 - Surge Immunity
norms.description: Immunity to surges (1.2/50μs voltage, 8/20μs current waveform) caused by switching, lightning. Line-to-line: 0.5 kV to 2 kV. Line-to-earth: 0.5 kV to 4 kV. Tests AC power, DC power, signal lines. Essential for outdoor installations and lightning-prone areas.

norms.name: IEC 61000-3-2 - Harmonic Current Emission Limits
norms.applies_to: Equipment with input current ≤16A per phase
norms.description: Limits for harmonic current emissions (up to 40th harmonic). Equipment classified: Class A (balanced 3-phase), Class B (portable tools), Class C (lighting), Class D (personal computers, monitors, TVs). Prevents harmonic distortion in power supply networks.

norms.name: IEC 61000-3-3 - Voltage Fluctuations and Flicker Limits
norms.applies_to: Equipment with input current ≤16A per phase
norms.description: Limitation of voltage changes, voltage fluctuations and flicker in low-voltage supply systems. Addresses cyclic load variations causing light flicker. Pst (short-term flicker) and Plt (long-term flicker) limits. Important for lighting quality and sensitive equipment.

norms.name: IEC 62133 Parts 1 & 2 - Rechargeable Battery Safety
norms.applies_to: Lithium-ion, lithium polymer, nickel-based rechargeable batteries
norms.description: Safety requirements for portable sealed secondary cells and batteries. Part 1: Nickel systems. Part 2: Lithium systems. Covers cells and batteries for use in portable applications. Tests include electrical abuse, mechanical abuse, thermal abuse, forced discharge, short circuit, overcharge.

norms.name: IEC 62619 - Industrial Battery Safety
norms.applies_to: Industrial lithium-ion batteries, energy storage systems
norms.description: Safety requirements for secondary lithium cells and batteries for industrial applications including stationary applications. Covers battery systems >12V and >100Wh. More stringent than IEC 62133. Tests include thermal stability, overcharge, over-discharge, external short circuit, mechanical tests.

norms.name: IEC 62660 Series - EV Battery Cells
norms.applies_to: Electric vehicle battery cells, traction battery cells
norms.description: Secondary lithium-ion cells for propulsion of electric road vehicles. Part 1: Performance testing. Part 2: Reliability and abuse testing. Part 3: Safety requirements. Covers high-power cells for xEVs. Includes crush test, thermal shock, nail penetration, overcharge.

norms.name: IEC 61508 - Functional Safety of E/E/PE Safety-Related Systems
norms.description: Foundation standard for functional safety of electrical/electronic/programmable electronic safety-related systems. 7 parts covering safety lifecycle, management, hardware requirements (Part 2), software requirements (Part 3). Defines Safety Integrity Levels (SIL 1-4). Basis for industry-specific standards.

norms.name: IEC 61511 - Functional Safety: Process Industry Sector
norms.applies_to: Safety instrumented systems in process industries
norms.description: Functional safety standard specific to process industry (chemical, petrochemical, oil & gas, pharmaceutical). Sector implementation of IEC 61508. Covers safety lifecycle, SIS requirements, design, operation, maintenance. Defines Safety Integrity Level (SIL) requirements for protection layers.

norms.name: IEC 62061 - Machinery Safety: Electrical Control Systems
norms.description: Safety of machinery – Functional safety of safety-related electrical, electronic and programmable electronic control systems. Alternative to ISO 13849-1 for machinery safety. Derived from IEC 61508. Defines Safety Integrity Level (SIL) approach. Applies to safety functions on machinery.

norms.name: IEC 60601-1 - Medical Electrical Equipment Safety
norms.applies_to: Medical electrical equipment and medical electrical systems
norms.description: General requirements for basic safety and essential performance of medical electrical equipment. Foundation standard with collateral standards (60601-1-X) and particular standards (60601-2-X). Covers electrical safety, mechanical hazards, radiation, usability engineering, risk management. Edition 3.1 includes major changes.

norms.name: IEC 60601-1-2 - Medical Equipment EMC
norms.applies_to: Medical electrical equipment and medical electrical systems
norms.description: Collateral standard: Electromagnetic disturbances – Requirements and tests for medical electrical equipment and systems. Edition 4.0 (2014) increased immunity test levels, added risk management process for EMC, extended frequency ranges. Emission and immunity requirements specific to medical environment.

norms.name: IEC 60601-1-6 - Medical Equipment Usability
norms.description: Collateral standard: Usability. Application of usability engineering to medical electrical equipment. Usability engineering process integrated with risk management. Covers user interface design, formative evaluation, summative evaluation. Harmonized with IEC 62366-1.

norms.name: IEC 60601-1-8 - Medical Equipment Alarms
norms.description: Collateral standard: General requirements, tests and guidance for alarm systems in medical electrical equipment and medical electrical systems. Covers alarm signals (auditory, visual, other), alarm conditions (high, medium, low priority), alarm system design, alarm testing. Addresses alarm fatigue.

norms.name: IEC 60601-2 Series - Particular Medical Equipment Requirements
norms.applies_to: Specific types of medical electrical equipment
norms.description: Particular standards for specific medical equipment types supplementing IEC 60601-1. Over 80 parts. Examples: 60601-2-2 (high frequency surgical), 60601-2-24 (infusion pumps), 60601-2-37 (ultrasound), 60601-2-47 (ambulatory ECG), 60601-2-52 (beds). Each addresses specific hazards.

norms.name: IEC 60529 - Degrees of Protection (IP Code)
norms.description: Ingress Protection (IP) rating system. First digit (0-6): protection against solid objects. Second digit (0-9): protection against liquids. Common codes: IP20 (touch-proof), IP44 (splash-proof), IP65 (dust-tight, water-jet), IP67 (temporary immersion), IP68 (continuous immersion). Third edition includes IPX9 (high pressure, high temperature).

norms.name: IEC 60079 - Explosive Atmospheres Equipment
norms.applies_to: Electrical equipment for explosive gas atmospheres
norms.description: Comprehensive series for equipment intended for use in explosive atmospheres. Part 0: General requirements. Protection methods: Ex d (flameproof), Ex e (increased safety), Ex i (intrinsic safety), Ex p (pressurization), Ex m (encapsulation), Ex o (oil immersion). Essential for ATEX/IECEx certification.

norms.name: IEC 60079-0 - Explosive Atmospheres: General Requirements
norms.applies_to: All Ex equipment for explosive gas atmospheres
norms.description: General requirements for construction, testing and marking of electrical equipment intended for use in explosive gas atmospheres. Defines Equipment Protection Levels (EPL): Ga (very high), Gb (high), Gc (enhanced). Temperature classification (T1-T6). Gas groups (IIA, IIB, IIC).

norms.name: IEC 60079-10-1 - Explosive Atmospheres: Area Classification for Gases
norms.applies_to: Classification of areas with explosive gas atmospheres
norms.description: Classification of areas where explosive gas atmospheres may occur. Defines Zone 0 (continuous), Zone 1 (likely), Zone 2 (unlikely). Methodology for extent determination considering release characteristics, ventilation, density. Critical for proper Ex equipment selection and installation.

norms.name: IEC 61215 - Crystalline Silicon PV Modules
norms.description: Terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules – Design qualification and type approval. Part 1: Test requirements. Part 2: Test procedures. Covers visual inspection, maximum power determination, insulation test, temperature coefficients, outdoor exposure, hot-spot endurance, UV test, thermal cycling, humidity-freeze, damp heat, mechanical load, hail test.

norms.name: IEC 61730 - PV Module Safety Qualification
norms.description: Photovoltaic (PV) module safety qualification. Part 1: Requirements for construction. Part 2: Requirements for testing. Covers electrical safety, fire safety, mechanical safety. Module classification (Class A, B, C) based on accessibility and voltage. Essential for PV module certification.

norms.name: IEC 62109 - PV Inverter Safety
norms.description: Safety of power converters for use in photovoltaic power systems. Part 1: General requirements. Part 2: Particular requirements for inverters. Covers electrical safety, fire hazards, mechanical hazards. Addresses DC isolation, ground fault protection, arc fault detection, anti-islanding.

norms.name: IEC 61400-1 - Wind Turbine Design Requirements
norms.applies_to: Wind turbines, wind power generation systems
norms.description: Wind energy generation systems – Part 1: Design requirements. Covers structural, mechanical, electrical, control systems. Wind turbine classes (I, II, III, IV) based on wind conditions. Loads analysis, safety factors, design life (20+ years). Foundation for wind turbine certification.

norms.name: IEC 62040-1 - UPS Safety Requirements
norms.description: Safety requirements for UPS used in operator accessible areas or restricted access locations. Covers electrical hazards, fire hazards, mechanical hazards, energy hazards. Battery safety requirements. Output terminals classification. Essential for UPS certification.

norms.name: IEC 62040-2 - UPS Electromagnetic Compatibility
norms.description: Electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) requirements for UPS systems. Emission limits for conducted and radiated disturbances. Immunity to electrical disturbances. Special considerations for bypass mode, battery mode, normal mode. Ensures UPS doesn't interfere with connected equipment.

norms.name: IEC 61851 - EV Charging Systems
norms.description: Electric vehicle conductive charging system. Part 1: General requirements. Part 21: AC requirements. Part 23: DC requirements. Part 24: Control communication. Defines charging modes (1-4), connector types, safety requirements, communication protocols. Basis for EV charging infrastructure.

norms.name: IEC 62196 - EV Charging Connectors
norms.applies_to: EV charging plugs, socket-outlets, vehicle connectors
norms.description: Plugs, socket-outlets, vehicle connectors and vehicle inlets – Conductive charging of electric vehicles. Part 1: General requirements. Part 2: AC pin and contact-tube accessories. Part 3: DC and AC/DC pin and contact-tube vehicle couplers. Defines Type 1 (SAE J1772), Type 2 (Mennekes), CCS.

norms.name: IEC 62368-3 - DC Power Transfer for ICT Equipment
norms.applies_to: DC-powered ICT equipment, USB-PD systems, PoE systems
norms.description: Safety aspects for DC power transfer through communication cables and ports. Covers USB Power Delivery, Power over Ethernet (PoE), and other DC transfer systems. Maximum voltages, current limits, safeguards. Ensures safe power transfer for ICT equipment without separate power supplies.

norms.name: IEC 60598-1 - Luminaire Safety
norms.description: General requirements for luminaires. Electrical, thermal, photobiological, mechanical safety. Covers construction, external and internal wiring, terminals, provisions for earthing, insulation requirements, thermal tests, fault conditions, IP classification. Foundation for luminaire safety.

norms.name: IEC 60598-2 Series - Particular Luminaire Requirements
norms.description: Particular requirements supplementing IEC 60598-1. Over 30 parts. Examples: Part 2-1 (fixed general purpose), Part 2-2 (recessed), Part 2-3 (road lighting), Part 2-4 (portable), Part 2-22 (emergency lighting). Each addresses specific luminaire type hazards and requirements.

norms.name: IEC 62031 - LED Modules for General Lighting
norms.applies_to: LED modules, LED light engines, LED arrays
norms.description: LED modules for general lighting – Safety specifications. Covers electrical, thermal, photobiological safety of LED modules. Thermal management, photobiological risk groups, marking requirements. Self-contained LED modules and semi-integrated modules. Essential for LED lighting certification.

norms.name: IEC 62471 - Photobiological Safety of Lamps and Lamp Systems
norms.description: Photobiological safety of lamps and lamp systems including LEDs. Risk groups: Exempt, RG1 (low risk), RG2 (moderate risk), RG3 (high risk). Addresses blue light hazard, UV hazard, infrared hazard, thermal hazard to skin. Measurement and classification procedures.

norms.name: IEC 61010-1 - Measurement, Control, Laboratory Equipment Safety
norms.applies_to: Test equipment, measurement instruments, laboratory equipment
norms.description: Safety requirements for electrical equipment for measurement, control, and laboratory use. Part 1: General requirements. Covers equipment for professional and domestic use. Measurement categories (CAT I-IV), overvoltage protection, working voltage, pollution degree, insulation coordination. Critical for test equipment.

norms.name: IEC 61010-2 Series - Particular Requirements for Specific Equipment
norms.description: Particular requirements supplementing IEC 61010-1. Examples: Part 2-030 (oscilloscopes), Part 2-031 (handheld multimeters), Part 2-033 (current clamps), Part 2-101 (in vitro diagnostic equipment). Each addresses specific hazards and measurement categories.

norms.name: IEC 60950-22 - Outdoor IT Equipment
norms.description: Equipment to be installed outdoors. Supplementary requirements to IEC 60950-1 for outdoor locations. Covers temperature extremes, solar radiation, precipitation, wind, ice, seismic, dust, corrosion, animals/insects, lightning, vandalism. Essential for telecom cabinets, outdoor installations.

norms.name: IEC 62368-2 - Outdoor AV/ICT Equipment (Under Development)
norms.description: Safety requirements for audio/video, information and communication technology equipment to be installed in outdoor locations. Will replace IEC 60950-22 for outdoor AV/ICT equipment. Covers environmental hazards: temperature, precipitation, wind, seismic, corrosion, lightning.

norms.name: IEC 60950-23 - Large Data Storage Equipment
norms.applies_to: Data storage equipment, storage arrays, SAN/NAS systems
norms.description: Large data storage equipment. Supplementary requirements to IEC 60950-1 for equipment with high power, large dimensions, heavy weight. Covers installation, serviceable parts, power distribution, thermal management, mechanical hazards. Applicable to enterprise storage systems.

norms.name: IEC 62368-4 - AV/ICT Equipment Data Centers (Under Development)
norms.applies_to: Data center equipment, servers, networking equipment
norms.description: Safety requirements for audio/video, information and communication technology equipment installed in data centers and large data storage applications. Will replace IEC 60950-23. Addresses high-power density, cooling, power distribution, installation, maintenance hazards.

norms.name: IEC 62368-5 - Wireless Power Transfer (Under Development)
norms.applies_to: Wireless charging systems, inductive power transfer
norms.description: Safety requirements for wireless power transfer for AV/ICT equipment. Covers inductive coupling, resonant coupling, RF power transfer. Frequency ranges, power levels, safety distances, EMF exposure limits, foreign object detection, thermal management.

norms.name: IEC 62304 - Medical Device Software Lifecycle
norms.applies_to: Medical device software, software as medical device (SaMD)
norms.description: Medical device software – Software life cycle processes. Defines software safety classes (A, B, C). Covers software development planning, requirements analysis, architectural design, detailed design, unit implementation and verification, integration and integration testing, system testing, software release, maintenance.

norms.name: IEC 62366-1 - Medical Device Usability Engineering
norms.description: Application of usability engineering to medical devices. Usability engineering process integrated with risk management per ISO 14971. Covers user interface specification, formative evaluation, summative evaluation, usability validation. Prevents use errors. Essential for medical device approvals.

norms.name: IEC 60601-1-11 - Medical Equipment for Home Healthcare
norms.description: Collateral standard: Requirements for medical electrical equipment and medical electrical systems used in the home healthcare environment. Addresses lay operator use, home environment hazards, simplified instructions, electromagnetic environment, reliability, usability for non-professionals.

norms.name: IEC 60601-1-12 - Medical Equipment Cybersecurity (Under Development)
norms.applies_to: Networked medical devices, connected medical equipment
norms.description: Collateral standard: Requirements for medical electrical equipment and medical electrical systems related to cybersecurity. Under development. Addresses security risk management, security controls, vulnerability management, incident response, software updates, secure development lifecycle.

norms.name: IEC 62443 - Industrial Automation and Control Systems Security
norms.applies_to: Industrial control systems, SCADA, DCS, PLC
norms.description: Comprehensive cybersecurity standard for industrial automation and control systems (IACS). Multiple parts: General (62443-1), Policies and procedures (62443-2), System (62443-3), Component (62443-4). Defines Security Levels (SL 1-4). Risk-based approach. Critical infrastructure protection.

norms.name: IEC 62443-3-3 - IACS System Security Requirements
norms.description: System security requirements and security levels for IACS. Defines 7 foundational requirements (FR): Identification and authentication, Use control, System integrity, Data confidentiality, Restricted data flow, Timely response, Resource availability. Each FR has requirements for SL 1-4.

norms.name: IEC 62443-4-1 - Secure Product Development Lifecycle
norms.description: Secure product development lifecycle requirements for IACS products. Covers security development lifecycle, security requirements, security architecture, secure implementation, security verification and validation, defect management, patch management, end of life.

norms.name: IEC 62443-4-2 - IACS Component Technical Security Requirements
norms.description: Technical security requirements for IACS components. Defines security levels (SL-C 1-4) for components. Same 7 foundational requirements as 62443-3-3 but applied at component level. Covers identification/authentication, use control, system integrity, data confidentiality.

norms.name: IEC 60034 Series - Rotating Electrical Machines
norms.description: Comprehensive standard series for rotating electrical machines. Multiple parts covering ratings, testing, construction, cooling, terminal markings, mounting arrangements, efficiency classes (IE1-IE5), vibration, noise. Essential for motor selection and specification.

norms.name: IEC 61439 Series - Low-Voltage Switchgear and Controlgear Assemblies
norms.applies_to: Switchboards, panelboards, motor control centers, distribution boards
norms.description: Low-voltage switchgear and controlgear assemblies. Part 1: General rules. Part 2: Power switchgear and controlgear assemblies (PSC). Part 3: Distribution boards. Covers type-tested and partially type-tested assemblies (PTTA). Verification methods, temperature rise, short-circuit withstand.

norms.name: IEC 60947 Series - Low-Voltage Switchgear and Controlgear
norms.description: Low-voltage switchgear and controlgear. Multiple parts: Part 1 (general rules), Part 2 (circuit-breakers), Part 3 (switches), Part 4-1 (contactors and motor-starters), Part 5 (control circuit devices). Covers electrical, mechanical, thermal endurance, short-circuit performance.

norms.name: IEC 60364 Series - Electrical Installations of Buildings
norms.description: Low-voltage electrical installations. Multiple parts covering fundamental principles, protection for safety, selection and erection of electrical equipment, verification, special installations. Foundation for national wiring regulations. Covers earthing, protection against electric shock, overcurrent protection.
